Question.Subject: Yahoo and its association with picnic.com?
Question.Content: Hi anybody out there using this service are there any issues regarding they wanting auto access your yahoo mail etc
Question.ChosenAnswer: Picnic? If that is the photo editing site, why would it want access to your email account? From my experience, it's not a dangerous site.

Answer.Content:
Any reputable website will not require you to give them access to your account - such as passwords. You should be able to use their service without giving them the details
These are often asked for to advertise it's service to your friends - you will be responsible for their spam! So don't give them the details (same as Facebook and similar - they ask for e-mail passwords so they can send e-mails to your contacts who arn't signed up)
Picnic? If that is the photo editing site, why would it want access to your email account? From my experience, it's not a dangerous site.
